xmlText.p: Go to https://agenda.afp.com to consult AFP Agenda
Contact us on contact-agenda@afp.com
LONDON (AFPTV) - We plan to file the following videos:
TBA indicates that times are to be announced, but coverage is confirmed. TBC indicates that coverage is to be confirmed.
For all editorial requests, email afptv@afp.com or contact the appropriate regional video desk.
WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 25, 2019
+ HIGHLIGHTS
LONDON (United Kingdom): Parliament reconvenes following Supreme Court decision
WASHINGTON (United States): Democrats launch impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump
BAIKONUR (Kazakhstan): First astronaut from UAE blasts off for ISS alongside astronauts from US, Russia
+ EUROPE
LONDON (United Kingdom): .Boris Johnson arrives at Downing Street - LIVE TBC
LONDON (United Kingdom): Parliament reconvenes following Supreme Court decision - TBC
.Scene outside Houses of Parliament - LIVE 1000 GMT
.Inside House of Commons as it reconvenes - LIVE 1030 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
MOSCOW (Russia): Venezuela's Maduro visits, meets Putin TAPE TURN - EDIT TO FOLLOW - LIVE 0900 GMT
MONACO (Principality of Monaco): IPCC press conference to present special report on the ocean and cryosphere - EDIT TO FOLLOW - LIVE 0900 GMT
BAIKONUR (Kazakhstan): Astronauts from US, Russia, UAE blast off for ISS - LIVE 1300 GMT
.Docking at ISS - LIVE 1900 GMT
.Astronauts from US, Russia, UAE blast off for ISS: Hatch opening and welcome ceremony - LIVE 2100 GMT
BAIKONUR (Kazakhstan): First UAE astronaut, along with astronauts from US and Russia, gives a press conference ahead of launch for ISS - TBC
PARIS (France): French #MeToo founder holds presser after verdict in defamation case. - LIVE 1330 GMT
BERLIN (Germany): Demonstration of forestry staff, while the German Ministry of agriculture holds a summit on forests - EDIT 1400 GMT
+ MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA
YAFOUR (Syria): Russian 'advisers' train new Syrian battalion - EDIT TBA
SALÉ (Morocco): Hearing in appeal trial of IS supporters sentenced for killing Scandinavian hikers - EDIT 1400 GMT
MORNAGUIA: Court rules on request to release jailed presidential contender Nabil Karoui - EDIT 1400 GMT
DOHA (Qatar): Qatari students march against climate change in a rare protest - EDIT 1400 GMT
DUBAI (United Arab Emirates): Cityscape Global opens, a property exhibition where hundreds of developers are expected to unveil new projects in a highly oversupplied market - EDIT 1400 GMT
JERUSALEM (Undefined): Israeli President Rivlin meets with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his main rival Benny Gantz. - LIVE 1500 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
RAMALLAH (Palestinian territories) Israeli security forces carry out raids in Ramallah - EDIT 1200 GMT
DUBAI (United Arab Emirates): Emiratis watch the launch of the first Emirati astronaut to the International Space Station - EDIT 1600 GMT
+ SUB SAHARAN AFRICA
DAKAR (Senegal): Senegal's powerful Mourides build 'biggest mosque in West Africa' - EDIT 1000 GMT
CAPE TOWN (South Africa): Prince Harry, Meghan meet archbishop Desmond Tutu - LIVE 0900 GMT
CAPE TOWN (South Africa): Duchess of Sussex visits HIV NGO Mothers 2 Mothers - LIVE 1230 GMT
+ ASIA PACIFIC
HONG KONG (China): Live outside a court where activists charged with rioting are expected to appear: Departures and potential statements - LIVE TBA
+ NORTH AMERICA
WASHINGTON (United States): Expected publication of Trump call with Ukrainian President Zelensky amid whistleblower scandal - EDIT TBA
NEW YORK (United States): Monitoring protests as Iranian President Rohani addresses UN General Assembly - EDIT TBA
.Beauty shot outside the UN - LIVE 1155 GMT
.World leaders arrive at the UN - LIVE 1200 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
.Day two of the UN General Assembly general debate with speeches including Iran, Ukraine, Libya - LIVE 1300 GMT
.Afternoon session - LIVE 1900 GMT
.Japanese PM Shinzo Abe holds presser - LIVE 2200 GMT TBC
.Iranian President Rouhani addresses UN General Assembly. Timings may change due to UN program - LIVE 1400 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
.Trump meets Japan PM Abe on sidelines of UNGA - EDIT 1700 GMT
.Trump meets his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky - EDIT 1830 GMT
.Trump holds presser on sidelines of UNGA - LIVE 2000 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
UNITED NATIONS (United States): Foreign ministers from signatory countries to the Iran nuclear deal JCPOA meet - LIVE 1230 GMT
.Foreign ministers from signatory countries to the Iran nuclear deal JCPOA meet. TAPE TURN - EDIT 1300 GMT
SEATTLE (United States): Amazon unveils new Alexa and Echo products - EDIT 2200 GMT
+ LATIN AMERICA & CARIBBEAN

MEXICO CITY (Mexico): Mexico Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard and undersecretary of Human Rights Alejandro Encinas take part in President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador press conference - Encinas will likely discuss the investigation on the 43 students who disappeared in 2014 - EDIT TBC
LIMA (Peru): Peruvian constitutional court rules on his request for release of Peru's imprisoned opposition leader Keiko Fujimori - EDIT TBA
BRASÍLIA (Brazil): Supreme Court hearing on Oderbrecht Lava Jato case that could lead to Lula's conviction being overturned - LIVE 1700 GMT TBC - EDIT TO FOLLOW
MEXICO CITY (Mexico): Relatives of the 43 students who disappeared in Mexico in 2014 protest in front of the office of Mexico's Attorney General - EDIT 1800 GMT
BRASÍLIA (Brazil): Senators debate and vote on the nomination of Augusto Aras, elected by Jair Bolsonaro to serve as attorney general of Brazil in the next two years - EDIT 2200 GMT
+ SPORT
ABUJA (Nigeria): Graft case resumes against Nigeria Football Federation bosses - EDIT TBA
KUMAMOTO (Japan): Rugby/World Cup. France press conference - EDIT 1030 GMT
DOHA (Qatar): IAAF Congress Press Conference to announce re-election of president Sebastian Coe - EDIT 1400 GMT TBC
DOHA (Qatar): Team USA gives a press conference ahead of World Athletics Championships - EDIT 1600 GMT
PARIS (France): Football/Ligue 1. PSG-Reims post-match mixed zone - EDIT 2345 GMT
+ FEATURES
PARIS (France): Presentation of the "Ethiquette" collection, a haute couture label that produces its pieces exclusively from recycled fabrics. - EDIT TBA
PARIS (France): Grape harvest in Montmartre at the foot of the Sacré-Coeur. - EDIT TBA
NANTES (France): The "Disgusting Food Museum" opens in Nantes. - EDIT TBA
SARLAT-LA-CANEDA (France): France Tabac, the country's last tabacco factory, is set to close this autumn in a fresh blow for the industry. - EDIT TBA
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 26, 2019
+ EUROPE
MOSCOW (Russia): Moscow City Court considers appeal of actor jailed in protest crackdown ON MERIT - EDIT TBA

BRUSSELS (Belgium): Japanese PM Shinzo Abe and EU Commission president Jean-Claude Juncker give speeches at the opening of the European Connectivity Forum EU-Asia connectivity EDIT ON MERIT - TBA - LIVE 0700 GMT

WARSAW (Poland): Renia Spiegel, a Polish Jew, had only just turned 18 when she was shot dead by the Nazis in 1942. Her secret diary however survived has now been turned into a book and movie - EDIT 1000 GMT
BRUSSELS (Belgium): Japanese PM Shinzo Abe meets EU Commission president Jean-Claud Juncker - EDIT 1130 GMT
FRANKFURT AM MAIN (Germany): Merkel gives a speech at a conference marking 70th anniversary of Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung daily - EDIT ON MERIT - LIVE 1110 GMT
MARGATE (United Kingdom): Press preview of Turner Prize 2019 shortlist - EDIT 1500 GMT TBC
GENEVA (Switzerland): Geneva city and area will switch-off of street lighting during an action to raise awareness about the impact of light pollution - EDIT 1930 GMT
+ SUB SAHARAN AFRICA
CHOBE (Botswana): Prince Harry visits Chobe National park - EDIT TBA
JOHANNESBURG (South Africa): UN expert on albinism press conference - EDIT TBA
+ ASIA PACIFIC
CAIRNS (Australia): Croc-spotting drone patrolling northern Australia launched - 0400 GMT
SHENZHEN (China): Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei headlines panel discussion, answers reporter questions - LIVE 0600 GMT
HONG KONG (China): Embattled Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam to hold first "dialogue session" - LIVE 1100 GMT
+ NORTH AMERICA
SAN FRANCISCO (United States): New Uber products launch - EDIT TBA
NEW YORK (United States): Day three of the UN General Assembly general debate with speeches expected from Venezuela, Palestine, South Sudan - LIVE 1300 GMT
NEW YORK (United States): Iranian President Rohani holds presser - LIVE 1600 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
+ SPORT
IWATA (Japan): Rugby/WC-2019: First round Pool A: Japan-Ireland. Ireland train two days ahead of match - EDIT 0330 GMT
KUALA LUMPUR (Malaysia): Underwater hockey to make waves at Southeast Asia mini-Olympics - EDIT 0400 GMT
IWATA (Japan): Rugby/WC-2019: First round Pool A: Japan-Ireland. Ireland team announcement - EDIT 0600 GMT
TOKYO (Japan): Rugby/World Cup: Wales press conference - EDIT 0600 GMT
TOKYO (Japan): Rugby/World Cup: Wales training - EDIT 0700 GMT
BEIJING (China): Press conference by former NBA star Jeremy Lin who has signed with Beijing Shougang Ducks - EDIT 0600 GMT
HAMAMATSU (Japan): Rugby/WC-2019: First round Pool A: Japan-Ireland. Japan team announcement - EDIT 0900 GMT
KARACHI (Pakistan): Cricket: Sri Lanka and Pakistan practice ahead of ODI clash - EDIT 1600 GMT
DOHA (Qatar): Opening press conference of the 17th IAAF World Athletics Championships - LIVE 1800 GMT - EDIT TO FOLLOW
+ FEATURES
Playa Hermosa (Costa Rica): In Costa Rica, following in the footsteps of Golfin turtles - EDIT 0500 GMT
SANTIAGO (Chile): From Chile to Panama, an ocean of plastic. Chile, Latin America's top garbage producer, seeks to reuse its plastic waste - EDIT 0500 GMT
SANTIAGO (Chile): From Chile to Panama, an ocean of plastic. Panama, Local anti-plastic initiatives battle against lack of environmental awareness - EDIT 0500 GMT
BERLIN (Germany): German woman boxer's fight to wear headscarf in the ring - EDIT 0200 GMT
